body:
@carlosantoniodasilva  This patch allow to read the cached value during the saving for example :

```ruby
def typecasted_attribute_value(name)
      if  self.class.serialized_attributes.include?(name)
        puts "serialized #{name} -> #{@attributes[name].serialized_value}"
        @attributes[name].serialized_value
      elsif   @attributes_cache[name.to_sym].class == @attributes[name].class
        puts "cached #{name} -> #{@attributes[name]} ->#{@attributes_cache[name.to_sym]}"
        @attributes[name] 
      else
        puts "read #{name} -> #{read_attribute(name)}"
        read_attribute(name) 
  end

p a = Developer.new
#<Developer id: nil, name: nil, salary: 70000, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil>
(rdb:1) p a.save
false
(rdb:1) p a.name = 'name'
"name"
(rdb:1) p a.save
=======arel_attributes_with_values
cached name -> name ->name
cached salary -> 70000 ->70000
read created_at -> 2012-09-10 19:55:14 UTC
read updated_at -> 2012-09-10 19:55:14 UTC
=======arel_attributes_with_values
read message -> Computer created
read developer_id -> 12
cached unvalidated_developer_id ->  ->
true
```
In other words during the saving if an ```attribute ```contains the  typecasted value it doesn't call the read_attribute. I think that gets better performaces, in particulare when you do a lot of change in existing  objects
